results.title: On the nose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
An introduction to the sense of smell. Animation is used to illustrate the operations of the smell receptors in the nasal cavities and how this information is processed by the brain. Clearly defines the concept of smelling and recognition of odours.

results.title: On the move
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Alex Ezard, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Sister Audrey Tomlinson and a team of several other nurses and aides describe their work and conditions. They travel around Queensland caring for Aborigines, and teach them basic preventive medicine.

results.title: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Lyn Norfor and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A trilogy about three teenagers seeking their independence in the outside world after finishing school. The three stories show the problems faced by a generation leaving school in the mid 1980s - boredom with school (“Exit Eddie Leech”), sexual pressures in the workplace (“Ring of Confidence”), and keeping a job (“Beginner’s luck”).

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Oehr, Lyn Norfor and New South Wales. Dept. of Health

results.title: On the Line
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson, SBS-TV and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: It’s a harsh, lonely life for the men, mostly European migrants, who work maintaining the railway around Redmont in north-west Western Australia. Labouring through searing heat over 426 kilometres of mountainous, desert region, these men talk candidly about their lives, providing psychological and social insight into what it is to be living in “isolation”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Greig, John Richardson, SBS-TV and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)

results.title: On the level: a little help from my friends
results.brief_description: Two boys work part-time packing fish on the docks. However, one continually abuses his friendship with the other by failing to keep appointments and not honoring promises. He dismisses his unreliability by saying that his friend will understand and that’s what friends are for. His casual attitude towards his responsibility eventually causes both himself and his friend to lose their jobs. A good discussion starter for addressing issues about expectations of friendship, dishonesty and sexism. Suitable for middle secondary level.
results.title_for_label: On the level: a little help from my friends

results.title: On the land (ii)
results.brief_description: Montage of colourful shots including a streetscape, livestock and grapepicking. Attractive illustrated title. Sound consists solely of a theme song. The music is upbeat, cheesey and evocative of television programmes of the 1970s and 1980s. Good countdown at begining, some numbers written as words, ie ‘six’ not ‘6’.

results.title: On the land (i)
results.brief_description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.
